japanese: ５年後――
translation: Five years later%p-2;――

japanese: いらっしゃ――
translation: Welcome%p-2;――

japanese: って、あんたたちか。
translation: Oh, it's you guys.

japanese: 一花、久しぶり。
translation: It's been a while, Ichika.

japanese:
うんうん。
２人とも元気そうでよかった。
translation:
It has, it has.
It's good to see both of you looking well.

japanese: お店も大繁盛のようで。
translation: And I see the shop is obviously bursting at the seams with customers.

japanese:
へー。
さすが、アメリカかぶれはジョークがお上手ね。
translation: Yeah, yeah, and here I thought you were better at those sarcastic American-style jokes.

japanese:
食べてくでしょ？
いま、用意するね。
translation:
Are you going to eat?
I'll prepare something now.

japanese: やった！
translation: Yay!

japanese:
ふんっ！
アメリカのあんな気取ったカフェに
行ってる人の口に合うかしら。
translation:
Hmph! I wonder if we'll suit the taste of someone
who goes to pretentious American cafes.

japanese:
あれ？
私が行ったこと教えたっけ？
translation:
Huh?
Did I tell you that I frequent those kinds of cafes.

japanese: 二乃、いつも一花のＳＮＳ見張ってるから。
translation: Nino is always keeping an eye your social media, Ichika.

japanese: 三玖！　言うんじゃないわよ！
translation: Miku! Don't say that!

japanese:
そうだ。
それならお礼に、このお店も紹介しちゃって……。
translation:
That's right.
In that case, as thanks,
I'll introduce this shop too...

japanese: 待って。
translation: Wait.

japanese:
一花の人気にあやかればお客さんも絶対増える。
とっても嬉しいけど、いまはまだ遠慮しとく。
translation:
If we ride on your popularity, Ichika,
our customers will definitely increase.
I'm really happy, but for now, I'll hold back.

japanese: 最近は常連さんも増えてきたんだ。
translation: Recently, there have been more regular customers too.

japanese:
こんな設備の整った場所を貸してくれた
お父さんのためにも……。
translation:
For the sake of my father-in-law,
who lent us this well-equipped place...

japanese: もう少しだけ、私たちの力だけでやってみたい。
translation:
I want to try running things
with our own power for a little longer.

japanese: えっ！？　な、なに？
translation: Huh?! W-what?

japanese:
うーん、自慢の妹！
どこに出しても恥ずかしくないよ。
translation:
Ohh, I'm so proud of my little sister!
I can take you anywhere without getting embarrassed.

japanese: また私が体調崩しちゃった時はよろしく。
translation: Please take care of me if I get sick again.

japanese: あれも……もう遠慮しとく……。
translation: About that... I politely decline...

japanese:
冗談。
お互い頑張ろうね。
translation: Just kidding. Let's both do our best, okay?

japanese: うん。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
あんたが売れなくなったら
働かせてあげてもいいわよ。
translation: If your popularity runs dry, I'll allow you to work for us.

japanese: あっちは可愛くないなー。
translation: Now this little sister, she's less cute.

japanese: あれはあれで可愛い
translation: Nino's cute in her own way.

japanese:
でも、変わらないなぁ。
日本に帰ってきたって感じがする。
translation:
Well, you guys haven't changed.
It feels like I've come back to Japan.

japanese: 一花、アメリカへ旅行に行ってただけでしょ。
translation: Ichika, you just went on a trip to America, right?

japanese: 一応、お仕事で行ってたんだからね？
translation: It WAS for work, you know?

japanese:
わかってるって。
どう？　手応えあった？
translation:
I know. How was it?
Did you have any success?

japanese:
うーん。
まだイントネーションだけが不安かな。
translation:
Hmm.
Well, I'm still worried about my inton-nation.

japanese:
一花。
イントネーション。
translation:
Ichika.
It's pronounced 'intonation.'

japanese:
あちゃー。
厳しいなー。
translation:
Ahhh.
You're so strict.

japanese: 一応、先生だからね。
translation: I mean, I am a teacher.

japanese:
あっ、みんな。
今日の主役の登場だよ。
translation:
Oh, everyone.
It's time for the lead character
to make an appearance.

japanese: どーも、みなさんお集まりで。
translation: Thank you all for coming.

japanese: いよいよ当日だね。
translation: It's finally the day, huh?

japanese: なんで汗だくなのよ。
translation: Why are you so sweaty?

japanese:
なんだかじっとしてられなくて、
うちから自転車で走ってきたんだ。
translation:
I just couldn't sit still,
so I rode my bike here from home.

japanese: 走ってきたって……。
translation: You rode your bike here?

japanese:
えっ！？　自宅から！？
大事な式の直前になにしてんのよ！？
translation:
WHAT?! From HOME?!
What are you doing
right before such an important ceremony?!

japanese:
元気だねー。
ここからあのマンションって意外と遠いもんね。
translation:
You're so energetic.
It's surprisingly far from here to that apartment.
Ah...

japanese: 一花にはまだ言ってなかったけど……。
translation: We haven't told you yet, Ichika...

japanese:
四葉、最近引っ越して、
フータローと一緒に東京で暮らしてるんだ。
translation:
Yotsuba recently moved,
and is living in Tokyo with Futaro.

japanese: え！
translation: Whaaa?!

japanese:
そうなんだ～、へぇ～。
幸せそうで結構ですな。
translation:
Oh really, how about that.
You look so happy together.

japanese: まだ慣れないことだらけでして……。
translation: There are still many things we're not used to...

japanese: さすがに上杉君は電車だよね？
translation: But as expected, Uesugi-kun took the train, right?

japanese:
うん。
風太郎は昨日から来てるよ。
translation: Yeah. Futaro has been here since yesterday.

japanese: だから、まだ寝てるんじゃ――
translation: So he's still sleeping, right%p-2;――

japanese: えっ、なに！？
translation: Huh, what?!

japanese: なんか、あっさり呼んだね。
translation: You called him by his first same so easily.

japanese: フータロー君のこと、いつから名前呼びにしたの？
translation:
Since when did you start calling Futaro-kun
by his name?

japanese:
えっ？
初めて呼んだのは……卒業旅行の時かな。
translation:
Huh? I think the first time was...
during the graduation trip.

japanese: あれ、本当だったんだ。
translation: Oh, that's true.

japanese:
あの時は初めてだったから、まだ恥ずかしくってさ。
なんか誤魔化しちゃったけどね。
translation:
It was the first time, so I was still embarrassed.
I tried to play it off, though.

japanese:
フー君と２人きりでデートだったものね。
あの時どこへ行ってたのよ？
translation:
You two were on a date alone together then.
Where did you guys go?

japanese: えへへ、それは秘密。
translation: Teehee, that's a secret.

japanese:
ふふっ！
四葉も変わったよね。
気がつけば敬語もやめてるし。
translation:
Hehehe! Yotsuba, you've changed a lot too.
You've even stopped using polite language.

japanese: やっぱり一緒に暮らしてると変わるの？
translation: Think it's because you started living together?

japanese:
うん、そうなのかも。
いまは自然と名前で呼ぶようになっちゃってるし。
translation:
It might be.
I just naturally call him by his name, now.

japanese: これは、いよいよ認めざるを得ないね。
translation: Well well, this is quite something!

japanese:
ふん。
だから、こんな朝っぱらから呼んだのよ。
translation:
Hmph.
So she even talks to him like that
so early in the morning.

japanese: 一花。
translation: Ichika.

japanese: つけてきたよ。
translation: I wore them here.

japanese:
私が預かってたほうは、
結局、しまったままだったわ。
translation:
The other ones we have
ended up staying in storage.

japanese: これが私たちからの結婚祝い。
translation: This is our wedding gift to you, Yotsuba.

japanese: お母さんの、形見のピアス。
translation: It's Mom's heirloom earrings.

japanese: こういうのって、あけてすぐつけていいの？
translation:
She'll be able to wear these 
right after getting pierced, right?

japanese: どのみち、今日つけないと間に合わないもんね。
translation:
Well, we won't make it in time
unless you wear them today.

japanese: 四葉、覚悟できてるわよね。
translation: Yotsuba, are you ready?

japanese:
うん。
お願いします。
translation:
Yeah.
Please help me.

japanese:
じゃあ、いくわよ、みんな。
せーの――
translation:
Alright, here we go, everyone.
One, two, three%p-2;――

japanese: 四葉、結婚おめでとう！
translation: Yotsuba, congratulations on your wedding!
OWW!!!

japanese:
な、なんか祝福以外の
感情を受けた気がするんだけど！
translation:
I-I feel like I'm getting some other emotions
besides congratulations from you guys.

japanese: さてね。
translation: Hmm...that's odd.

japanese:
もう片方行くわよ！
一花、押さえてなさい！
translation:
Let's do the other side too!
Ichika, hold onto her!

japanese: はーい。
translation: You got it.

japanese: そろそろ私たちも会場に行こっか。
translation: We should probably head to the venue soon.

japanese: ええ、諸々の準備があるもんね。
translation:
Yes, there are some things that need to be done
before the ceremony.

japanese: あ、私の担当メイクさん来てくれるって。
translation: Oh, my makeup artist will come too.

japanese: ほ、本当にやるの！？
translation: R-really?!

japanese:
なに怖じ気付いてんのよ。
あんただって乗り気だったじゃない。
translation:
What are you so nervous about?
You were looking forward to this.

japanese:
だね。
上杉君には確かめておかないと。
translation:
That's right.
We'll have check in with Uesugi-kun too.

japanese: やるわよ、四葉。
translation: Here we go, Yotsuba.

japanese: せ、せめて一思いに！
translation: A-at least make it quick!
Three...two...one...

japanese:
０！！
で行くわよ！
translation:
ZERO!!
And VOILA!

japanese: ギャー！！
translation: OW-OW-OWWW!!
